comments:

(binary+CVS) that are part of Eclipse.  It failed when it 
reached "org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor".  Pressing delete again deleted 
the remaining projects.  The log file is below:

The exception that is included above is thrown from the decorator thread. The 
problem is that project deletion first removes the contents form disk and then 
cleans up the internal Core data structures. Because of this, the decorator 
access fails.

However, the decorator failure should not prevent deletion. Was there nothing 
else in the log that may have indicated why the deletion failed?
Was there a failure message that appeared in the error dialog?
Yes, it specific the project that it had stopped at.

There are two issues here:

1) The CVS decorator is accessing a project as it is being deleted. I'm not 
sure how to best handle this. We could detect this case and ignore it but if 
we remove the logged exception, the user would have no hint as to why the 
deletion failed.

2) The operation stops deleting projects when an error is encountered but 
should probably continue with the other projects. I have opened bug 47244 
against Platform UI for this.
